hero.byline: I am a Product Manager with a background in web design and software engineering.

product.title: Building cool tech
product.byline: My most recent experience comes from diving deep into the needs of users & the business that services them to build something truly unique.
product.description: I have really enjoyed being able to explore solutions to complex and intricate problems, whilst bringing a background centered in technical delivery to be able to correctly manage scope and viability within the bounds of a web application.

code.title: A love of coding
code.byline: A developer for three years now, I still enjoy nothing more than hitting the tools and putting ideas into reality.
code.description: I have worked professionally as a Frontend developer and also have a deep understanding of the entire stack for most web applications.

footer.pre: Want to see how this website was made?

valiant.title: Production app experience
valiant.byline: Through my work at Valiant Finance I was able to interact with all areas of web application creation, from design & UI ideation to product management & development.
valiant.description: The Valiant application provided me with brilliant exposure to a plethora of technologies hidden throughout the stack. From the Vue frontend, Ruby-on-Rails Backend and Salesforce CRM, my position required a strong understanding of every area to ensure the best decisions could be made for the business & the developers.

university.title: BA Technology & Innovation
university.byline: I studied a modern degree that builds upon a conventional technology course by adding important elements of entrepreneurialism and product management.
university.description: Instead of a conventional thesis, my university encouraged us to take on a major Capstone project in our final year in an area of our choosing. My application, "Scancycle", indexed every product within a supermarket and allowed a user to learn about the ways to recycle each item by scanning the barcode with their phone!

personal.title: Learning outside of work
personal.byline: I am always looking for new ways to expand my current skillsets and pick up new knowledge in fields I haven't yet explored.
personal.description: In my free time I often assist my friends and peers with various design and software engineering projects. Each one provides their own challenges and allows me to think about new problems that I may not come across in my day-to-day job.
